'Archive-name: atheism/logic Alt-atheism-archive-name: logic Last-modified: April 1993 Version: Constructing Logical Argument Although there much argument Usenet, general quality argument found poor. This article attempts provide gentle introduction logic, hope improving general level debate. Logic science reasoning, proof, thinking, inference [Concise OED]. Logic allows analyze piece reasoning determine whether correct (valid invalid). course, does need study logic order reason correctly- nevertheless, little basic knowledge logic often helpful when constructing analyzing argument. Note that claim being made here about whether logic universally applicable. matter very much open debate. This document merely explains logic, given that have already decided that logic right tool job. Propositions statements) building blocks logical argument. proposition statement which either true false- example, raining Today Tuesday. Propositions either asserted (said true) denied (said false). Note that this technical meaning deny, everyday meaning. proposition meaning statement, particular arrangement words used express exists There exists both express same proposition. argument quote Monty Python sketch, connected series statements establish definite proposition. argument consists three stages. First all, propositions which necessary argument continue stated. These called premises argument. They evidence reasons accepting argument conclusions. Premises assertions) often indicated phrases such because, since, obviously (The phrase obviously often viewed with suspicion, used intimidate others into accepting suspicious premises. something doesn\'t seem obvious you, don\'t afraid question always yes, you\'re right, obvious when you\'ve heard explanation.) Next, premises used derive further propositions process known inference. inference, proposition arrived basis more other propositions already accepted. There various forms valid inference. propositions arrived inference then used further inference. Inference often denoted phrases such implies that therefore. Finally, arrive conclusion argument proposition which affirmed basis premises inference. Conclusions often indicated phrases such therefore, follows that, conclude conclusion often stated final stage inference. example: Every event cause (premise) universe beginning (premise) beginnings involve event (premise) This implies that beginning universe involved event (inference) Therefore universe cause (inference conclusion) Note that conclusion argument might premise another argument. proposition only called premise conclusion with respect particular argument- terms make sense isolation. Sometimes argument will follow order given above- example, conclusions might stated first premises stated afterwards support conclusion. This perfectly valid, sometimes little confusing. Recognizing argument much harder than recognizing premises conclusions. Many people shower their writing with assertions without ever producing anything which might reasonably describe argument. Some statements look like arguments, not. example: Bible accurate, Jesus must either have been insane, evil liar, God. This argument, conditional statement. does assert premises which necessary support what appears conclusion. also suffers from number other logical flaws, we\'ll come those later.) Another example: created you- therefore your duty God. phrase your duty proposition, since neither true false. Therefore conclusion, sentence argument. Finally, causality important. Consider statement form because we\'re interested establishing offered evidence, statement argument. we\'re trying establish truth then argument, explanation. example: There must something wrong with engine car, because will start. This argument. will start because there something wrong with engine. This explanation. There traditional types argument, deductive inductive. deductive argument which provides conclusive proof conclusions that argument where premises true, conclusion must also true. deductive argument either valid invalid. valid argument defined where premises true, then conclusion true. inductive argument where premises provide some evidence truth conclusion. Inductive arguments valid invalid- however, talk about whether they better worse than other arguments, about probable their premises are. There forms argument ordinary language which neither deductive inductive. However, will concentrate moment deductive arguments, they often viewed most rigorous convincing. important note that fact that deductive argument valid does imply that conclusion holds. This because slightly counter-intuitive nature implication, which must consider more carefully. Obviously valid argument consist true propositions. However, argument entirely valid even contains only false propositions. example: insects have wings (premise) Woodlice insects (premise) Therefore woodlice have wings (conclusion) Here, conclusion true because argument\'s premises false. argument\'s premises were true, however, conclusion would true. argument thus entirely valid. More subtly, reach true conclusion from more false premises, fish live (premise) Dolphins fish (premise) Therefore dolphins live (conclusion) However, thing cannot reach false conclusion through valid inference from true premises. therefore draw truth table implication. symbol denotes implication- premise, conclusion. represent true false respectively. Premise Conclusion Inference A=>B ---------------------------- premises false inference valid, conclusion true false. premises true conclusion false, inference must invalid. premises true inference valid, conclusion must true. sound argument valid argument whose premises true. sound argument therefore arrives true conclusion. careful confuse valid arguments with sound arguments. delve further into structure logical arguments would require lengthy discussion linguistics philosophy. simpler probably more useful summarize major pitfalls avoided when constructing argument. These pitfalls known fallacies. everyday English term fallacy used refer mistaken beliefs well faulty reasoning that leads those beliefs. This fair enough, logic term generally used refer form technically incorrect argument, especially argument appears valid convincing. purposes this discussion, define fallacy logical argument which appears correct, which seen incorrect when examined more closely. studying fallacies avoid being misled them. following list fallacies intended exhaustive. ARGUMENTUM BACULUM (APPEAL FORCE) Appeal Force committed when arguer resorts force threat force order push acceptance conclusion. often used politicians, summarized might makes right. force threatened need direct threat from arguer. example: Thus there ample proof truth Bible. those refuse accept that truth will burn Hell. ARGUMENTUM HOMINEM Argumentum hominem literally argument directed man. Abusive variety Argumentum Hominem occurs when, instead trying disprove truth assertion, arguer attacks person people making assertion. This invalid because truth assertion does depend upon goodness those asserting example: Atheism evil philosophy. practised Communists murderers. Sometimes court doubt cast upon testimony witness showing, example, that known perjurer. This valid reducing credibility testimony given witness, argumentum hominem- however, does demonstrate that witness\'s testimony false. conclude otherwise fall victim Argumentum Ignorantiam (see elsewhere this list). circumstantial form Argumentum Hominem committed when person argues that opponent ought accept truth assertion because opponent\'s particular circumstances. example: perfectly acceptable kill animals food. argue otherwise when you\'re quite happy wear leather shoes? This abusive charge inconsistency, used excuse dismissing opponent\'s argument. This fallacy also used means rejecting conclusion. example: course would argue that positive discrimination thing. You\'re white. This particular form Argumentum Hominem, when alleges that one\'s adversary rationalizing conclusion formed from selfish interests, also known poisoning well. ARGUMENTUM IGNORANTIUM Argumentum ignorantium means argument from ignorance. This fallacy occurs whenever argued that something must true simply because been proved false. equivalently, when argued that something must false because been proved true. (Note that this same assuming that something false until been proved true, basic scientific principle.) Examples: course Bible true. Nobody prove otherwise. course telepathy other psychic phenomena exist. Nobody shown proof that they real. Note that this fallacy does apply court law, where generally assumed innocent until proven guilty. Also, scientific investigation known that event would produce certain evidence having occurred, absence such evidence validly used infer that event occur. example: flood described Bible would require enormous volume water present earth. earth does have tenth much water, even count that which frozen into poles. Therefore such flood occurred. science, validly assume from lack evidence that something occurred. cannot conclude with certainty that occurred, however. ARGUMENTUM MISERICORDIAM This Appeal Pity, also known Special Pleading. fallacy committed when arguer appeals pity sake getting conclusion accepted. example: murder mother father with axe. Please don\'t find guilty- I\'m suffering enough through being orphan. ARGUMENTUM POPULUM This known Appealing Gallery, Appealing People. commit this fallacy attempt acceptance assertion appealing large group people. This form fallacy often characterized emotive language. example: Pornography must banned. violence against women. Bible must true. Millions people know that trying tell them that they mistaken fools? ARGUMENTUM NUMERAM This fallacy closely related argumentum populum. consists asserting that more people support believe proposition, more likely that that proposition correct. ARGUMENTUM VERECUNDIAM Appeal Authority uses admiration famous support assertion. example: Isaac Newton genius believed God. This line argument always completely bogus- example, reference admitted authority particular field relevant discussion that subject. example, distinguish quite clearly between: Stephen Hawking concluded that black holes give radiation John Searle concluded that impossible build intelligent computer Hawking physicist, reasonably expect opinions black hole radiation informed. Searle linguist, questionable whether well-qualified speak subject machine intelligence. FALLACY ACCIDENT Fallacy Accident committed when general rule applied particular case whose accidental circumstances mean that rule inapplicable. error made when goes from general specific. example: Christians generally dislike atheists. Christian, must dislike atheists. This fallacy often committed moralists legalists decide every moral legal question mechanically applying general rules. CONVERSE ACCIDENT HASTY GENERALIZATION This fallacy reverse fallacy accident. occurs when forms general rule examining only specific cases which representative possible cases. example: Bakker insincere Christian. Therefore Christians insincere. SWEEPING GENERALIZATION DICTO SIMPLICITER sweeping generalization occurs when general rule applied particular situation which features that particular situation render rule inapplicable. sweeping generalization opposite hasty generalization. CAUSA CAUSA POST ERGO PROPTER These known False Cause fallacies. fallacy Causa Causa occurs when identifies something cause event actually been shown cause. example: took aspirin prayed God, headache disappeared. cured headache. fallacy Post Ergo Propter occurs when something assumed cause event merely because happened before event. example: Soviet Union collapsed after taking atheism. Therefore must avoid atheism same reasons. ERGO PROPTER This fallacy similar post ergo propter hoc. asserts that because events occur together, they must causally related, leaves room other factors that cause(s) events. PETITIO PRINCIPII This fallacy occurs when premises least questionable conclusion reached. CIRCULUS DEMONSTRANDO This fallacy occurs when assumes premise conclusion which wishes reach. Often, proposition will rephrased that fallacy appears valid argument. example: Homosexuals must allowed hold government office. Hence government official revealed homosexual will lose job. Therefore homosexuals will anything hide their secret, will open blackmail. Therefore homosexuals cannot allowed hold government office. Note that argument entirely circular- premise same conclusion. argument like above actually been cited reason British Secret Services\' official homosexual employees. Another example classic: know that exists because Bible tells know that Bible true because word God. COMPLEX QUESTION FALLACY INTERROGATION This Fallacy Presupposition. example classic loaded question: Have stopped beating your wife? question presupposes definite answer another question which even been asked. This trick often used lawyers cross-examination, when they questions like: Where hide money stole? Similarly, politicians often loaded questions such long will this interference affairs allowed continue? Does Chancellor plan more years ruinous privatization? IGNORATIO ELENCHI fallacy Irrelevant Conclusion consists claiming that argument supports particular conclusion when actually logically nothing with that conclusion. example, Christian begin saying that will argue that teachings Christianity undoubtably true. then argues length that Christianity great help many people, matter well argues will have shown that Christian teachings true. Sadly, such fallacious arguments often successful because they arouse emotions which cause others view supposed conclusion more favourable light. EQUIVOCATION Equivocation occurs when word used with more different meanings same argument. example: What could more affordable than free software? make sure that remains free, that users what they like with must place license make sure that will always freely redistributable. AMPHIBOLY Amphiboly occurs when premises used argument ambiguous because careless ungrammatical phrasing. ACCENT Accent another form fallacy through shifting meaning. this case, meaning changed altering which parts statement emphasized. example, consider: should speak friends should speak FRIENDS FALLACIES COMPOSITION fallacy composition conclude that property shared parts something must apply whole. example: bicycle made entirely mass components, therefore very lightweight. other fallacy composition conclude that property number individual items shared collection those items. example: uses less petrol causes less pollution than bus. Therefore cars less environmentally damaging than buses. FALLACY DIVISION fallacy division opposite fallacy composition. Like opposite, exists varieties. first assume that property some thing must apply parts. example: studying rich college. Therefore must rich. other assume that property collection items shared each item. example: Ants destroy tree. Therefore this destroy tree. SLIPPERY SLOPE ARGUMENT This argument states that should event occur, will other harmful events. There proof made that harmful events caused first event. example: legalize marijuana, then would have legalize crack heroin we\'ll have nation full drug-addicts welfare. Therefore cannot legalize marijuana. BASED FALLACIES TYPE FALLACIES These fallacies occur when attempts argue that things some similar without actually specifying what they similar. Examples: Isn\'t history based upon faith? then isn\'t Bible also form history? Islam based faith, Christianity based faith, isn\'t Islam form Christianity? Cats form animal based carbon chemistry, dogs form animal based carbon chemistry, aren\'t dogs form cat? AFFIRMATION CONSEQUENT This fallacy argument form implies true, therefore true. understand fallacy, examine truth table implication given earlier. DENIAL ANTECEDENT This fallacy argument form implies false, therefore false. Again, truth table implication makes clear this fallacy. Note that this fallacy different from Causa Causa- latter form implies false, therefore false, where does fact imply all. Here, problem that implication invalid- rather that falseness does allow deduce anything about CONVERTING CONDITIONAL This fallacy argument form then therefore then ARGUMENTUM ANTIQUITAM This fallacy asserting that something right good simply because old, because that\'s it\'s always been. ARGUMENTUM NOVITAM This opposite argumentum antiquitam- fallacy asserting that something more correct simply because newer than something else. ARGUMENTUM CRUMENAM fallacy believing that money criterion correctness- that those with more money more likely right. ARGUMENTUM LAZARUM fallacy assuming that because someone poor sounder more virtuous than wealthier. This fallacy opposite argumentum crumenam. ARGUMENTUM NAUSEAM This incorrect belief that assertion more likely true more often heard. argumentum nauseum that employs constant repetition asserting something. BIFURCATION Also referred black white fallacy, bifurcation occurs when presents situation having only alternatives, where fact other alternatives exist exist. PLURIUM INTERROGATIONUM MANY QUESTIONS This fallacy occurs when questioner demands simple answer complex question. SEQUITUR non-sequitur argument where conclusion drawn from premises which logically connected with HERRING This fallacy committed when irrelevant material introduced issue being discussed, that everyone\'s attention diverted away from points being made, towards different conclusion. REIFICATION HYPOSTATIZATION Reification occurs when abstract concept treated concrete thing. SHIFTING BURDEN PROOF burden proof always person making assertion proposition. Shifting burden proof, special case argumentum ignorantium, fallacy putting burden proof person denies questions assertion being made. source fallacy assumption that something true unless proven otherwise. STRAW straw fallacy misrepresent someone else\'s position that attacked more easily, then knock down that misrepresented position, then conclude that original position been demolished. fallacy because fails deal with actual arguments that have been made. EXTENDED ANALOGY fallacy Extended Analogy often occurs when some suggested general rule being argued over. fallacy assume that mentioning different situations, argument about general rule, constitutes claim that those situations analogous each other. This fallacy best explained using real example from debate about anti-cryptography legislation: believe always wrong oppose breaking Such position odious: implies that would have supported Martin Luther King. saying that cryptography legislation important struggle Black liberation? dare you! QUOQUE This famous fallacy. occurs when action argued acceptable because other party performed instance: You\'re just being randomly abusive. You\'ve been abusive too.'

DEC\'s FTPMAIL ------------- Send one-line message ftpmail@decwrl.dec.com WITHOUT Subject: field, having line containing word \'help\'. should back message detailing relevant procedures must follow order files want. Note that reply answer command your mailer will work this message other mail receive from FTPMAIL. send requests FTPMAIL, send original mail message, reply. Complaints should sent ftpmail-request@uucp-gw-2.pa.dec.com address rather than postmaster, since DECWRL\'s postmaster responsible fixing ftpmail problems. BITFTP ------ BITNET sites ONLY, there\'s BITFTP@PUCC. Send one-line \'help\' message this address more info. 'McDonnell Douglas rolls DC-X HUNTINGTON BEACH, Calif. picture-perfect Southern California day, McDonnell Douglas rolled DC-X rocket ship last Saturday. company hopes this single-stage rocket technology demonstrator will first step towards single-stage-to-orbit (SSTO) rocket ship. white conical vehicle scheduled White Sands Missile Range Mexico this week. Flight tests will start mid-June. Although there wasn\'t cloud noonday sky, forecast SSTO research remains cloudy. Organization which paid million DC-X can\'t itself afford fund full development follow-on vehicle. necessary hundreds millions required sub-orbital DC-XA, SDIO passing among sister government agencies. SDIO originally funded SSTO research costs orbital deployments space-based sensors weapns. However, recent changes SDI\'s political marching orders budget cuts have made SSTO less priority. Today, agency more interested using DC-X step towards low-cost, reusable sounding rocket. SDIO already done briefings other government agencies, said Col. Simon Pete Worden, SDIO\'s deputy technology. Worden declined much agencies would have pony program. didn\'t make colonel telling contractors much money have available spend, quipped press conference McDonnell Douglas Astronautics headquarters. While SDIO lowered sights program\'s orbital objective, agency officials hail DC-X example better, faster, cheaper approach hardware development. agency believes this philosophy produce breakthroughs that leapfrog ahead evolutionary technology developments. Worden said DC-X illustrates build little, test little approach produce results time within budget. said program which went from concept hardware around months showed today\'s engineers could move beyond miracles parents\' time. management, Worden said. SDIO very light hand this project. only overworked major, Jess Sponable. Although next phase involve more agencies, Worden said lean management sense government-industry partnership will crucial. It\'s essential with large management structure where price goes exponentially. SDIO\'s approach also praise from California members House Science, Space Technology Committee. This direction we\'re going have said Rep. George Brown, committee\'s Democratic chairman. Programs that stretch aout years aren\'t sustainable....NASA hasn\'t learned yet. SDIO has. Rep. Dana Rohrbacher, Brown\'s Republican colleague, went further. Joking that shrimp fish designed NASA design team, Rohrbacher doubted that program ever would have been completed were left civil space agency. Rohrbacher, whose Orange County district includes McDonnell Douglas, also criticized NASA-Air Force work conventional, multi-staged rockets placing casings around missile technology. Let\'s build fancy ammunition with capsules top. Let\'s build spaceship! Although Rohrbacher praised SDIO\'s sponsorship, said private sector needs take lead developing SSTO technology. McDonnell Douglas, which faces very uncertain prospects with C-17 transport Space Station Freedom programs, were more cautious about large private secotro commitment. very large ventures, companies seed money, said Charles Ordahl, McDonnell Douglas\' senior vice president space systems. need strong government investments. While government industry continue differ funding DC-XA, they agree continuing incremental approach development. Citing corporate history, they liken process Douglas Aircraft\'s aircraft. Just earlier aircraft paved DC-3 transport, gradual evolution single-stage rocketry could eventually lead orbital Delta Clipper (DC-1). Flight tests this summer White Sands will expand envelope performance, with successive tests increasing speed altitude. first tests will reach feet demonstrate hovering, verticle take-off landing. second series will send unmanned DC-X 5,000 feet. third final series will take craft 20,000 feet. Maneuvers will become more complex third phase. final tests will include pitch-over manever that rotates vehicle back into bottom-down configuration soft, four-legged landing. flight test series will supervised Charles Pete Conrad, performed similar maneuvers Apollo moon landing. McDonnell Douglas vice president, Conrad paised vehicles aircraft-like approach operations. Features include automated check-out access panels easy maintainance. program moves next stage, engine technology will become consideration. This engine would have more thrust than Pratt Whitney RL10A-5 engines used DC-X. Each motor uses liquid hydrogen liquid oxygen propellants generate 14,760 pounds thrust Based engine used Centaur upper stages, model thrust champer designed level operation three-to-on throttling capability. also designed repeat firings rapid turnaround. Worden said future single-stage rockets could employ tri-propellant engine technology developed former Soviet Union. resulting engines could burn dense hydrocarbon fuel takeoff then switch liquid hydrogen higher altitudes.'

DKBtrace another good tracer, from reports- PCs, \tAmiga, UNIX, (last with previewer), etc. RTrace Portugese tracer, does bicubic patches, CSG, text, etc. etc. \tAn MS-DOS version with DJGPP extender (GO32) exists also, \tas port. VIVID2 shareware raytracer binary only (286/287). Author: \tStephen (coy@ssc-vax.boeing.com). 386/387 source) version \tis available registered users (US$50) direct from author. RAY4 Steve Hollasch\'s 4-dimensional tracer renders hyperspheres, \thypertetrahedra, hyperplanes, hyperparallelepipeds (there\'s separate real-time wireframe viewer written called WIRE4 MTV,QRT,DBW more tracers, some with interesting features. Distributed/Parallel Raytracers: -------------------------------- XDART distributed ray-tracer that runs under X11. There server binaries \twhich work only DECstations, SPARCs, Snakes (7x0 series) NeXT. \tThe clients distributed binaries source. Inetray network version Rayshade 4.0. Needs newer. \tContact Andreas Thurnherr (ant@ips.id.ethz.ch) prt, VM_pRAY parallel tracers. Volume renderers: ----------------- VREND Cornell\'s Volume Renderer, from Kartch/Devine/Caffey/Warren (FORTRAN). Radiosity (and diffuse lighting) renderers: ------------------------------------------- Radiance tracer w/radiosity effects, Greg Ward. Excellent shading \tmodels physically based lighting simulation. Unix/X based, though \thas been ported Amiga (386). INDIA Indian radiosity package based Radiance. SGI_RAD interactive radiosity package that runs machines with \tSpaceball. includes house database. \tAuthor: Moreillon <moreillo@ligsg1.epfl.ch> simple public-domain radiosity package solution \tstand-alone Unix box, walk-through requires \tAuthor: Bernard Kwok <g-kwok@cs.yorku.ca> Renderers which raytracers, graphics libraries: ----------------------------------------------------------- SIPP Scan line z-buffer Phong shading renderer. \tNow uses shadow buffer algorithm. Tcl-SIPP command interface SIPP rendering \tprogram. Tcl-SIPP commands used programmed \tSIPP without having write compile code. \tCommands used specify surfaces, objects, \tscenes rendering options. \tIt renders either format Utah Raster Toolkit format \tor photo widget Tk-based applications. VOGLE graphics learning environment (device portable). VOGL GL-like library based VOGLE. REND386 *fast* polygon renderer Intel 386s Version It\'s photorealistic, rather real-time renderer] XSHARP21 Dobb\'s Journal renderer source code, with budget texture \tmapping. Modellers, wireframe viewers: ----------------------------- VISION-3D modeler, output Radiance Rayshade files. IRIT solid modeler, with support freeform surfaces. wireframe viewer X11. wireframe graphics toolkit, with source, objects, other stuff \tLook major archives like wuarchive. such file 3DKIT1.ZIP PV3D shareware front modeler POVRAY, still beta test. French docs now, price registering French Francs. Save disabled. Some extra utilities, files registered version. TDDD Imagine modeler) format, converters RayShade, NFF, OFF, etc. \tAlso includes nice postscript object displayer. Some GREAT models. Written Material Rendering: ------------------------------ News collections articles tracing. references articles tracing refer format. references articles radiosity (global illumination). Speer Rick Speer\'s cross-referenced bib, postscript. abstracts collection Wilson abstracts many articles. Paper bank project various technical papers electronic form. 'This discussion objective seems falling into solipsism (Eg: recent challenge from Frank Dwyer, someone prove that actually observe phenomena). Someones even made statement that science subjective that even atom subjective. This getting silly word objective losing meaning. Lets start remembering definition objective which been already presented: objective ADJ. having with material object distinguished from mental concept. Having actual existence. 3.a. Unenfluenced emotion personal prejudice. Based observable phenomenon. Objectivity thing based whether everyone agrees that thing (eg: world objectively round, regardless fact that there exist flat earthers), rather whether based observable verifiable phenomenon (instead being based solely peoples wishes, feeling, mental processes, etc). Thus atoms, being based very observable repeatable phenomenon, indeed considered objective rather than subjective. Even weird, high energy physics based observable phenomenon (even though that observation change outcome). those observable phenomenon affected emotion, personal prejudice (eg: chemical reactions change whims different people). Thus that science objective (ie: objectively verifiable) silly, that point science. will agree that science objectively good- will thereby conclude though that science objective. some examples things which objective: D-12 tractor larger than average breadbox. Chlorophyll green. Seawater contains salt. There exists ozone atmosphere least presently). Ozone blocks ultraviolet light. Ultraviolet light increases incidents skin Cancer. Good other hand value judgement. doesn\'t seem have existence apart from what give (unless someone objectively show existence omnipotent entity which defined good). cannot quantify touch collect concrete sense (eg: have full good). sometimes attempt give word good objective meaning, e.g. good been used denote strength, resiliency, speed, etc. That though, subjective definition, some might strength etc, necessarily good (eg: strength inspired Naziism generally viewed good). morality, cannot that have ever seen morality strictly based verifiable observable phenomenon. closest have seen some form Golden Rule, which concludes that best deliberately piss people off, they will likely then involve themselves your life, manner won\'t like. This verifiable- when someone\'s face, they will often retaliate. Another objective fact about morality that more powerful group enforce their morality weaker group, thus times, ignore that form Golden Rule without fear reprisal. whether this enforcing morality good bad, quite subjective. way, remember that subjective does mean that thing cannot formally stated, even commonly agreed upon- only means that that verifiable from observable phenomena, physical existence unto itself. Also note that have stated that there such thing objective morality, that could accept such morality- have simply stated that have seen evidence such morality. other thing notice, objective many times used synonymous with true and/or absolute, subjective sometimes connotation false and/or relative. Tain\'t necessarily instance, when conclusion based objective, insufficient evidence, then both objective false. absolute, easy note that while objectively show that explosive, that does absolutely mean that will explode, thus objective necessarily absolute either. other hand, something subjective also either absolutist, true. instance, there some theists specifically absolutist their morality, even though they have only subjective evidence back Further, many scientist detective been motivated subjective reasons (eg: feeling hunch), investigate phenomena situation, gather objective evidence necessary support true hypothesis. whole though, would have agree that objective evidence much more trustworthy than subjective evidence. \t\t\t\tLater, \t\t\t\tDave Butler'
